phrase.item: It is said that among the Tajiks there are two kinds of religion: Panjtani [Shia] and Choryori [Sunni].
The word Panjtani ["Five People"] refers to Muhammad, Ali, Fatima, Hasan, and Hussein.
But Choryori ["Four Friends"] refers to Abubakr, Ummar, Usman, and Haydar [Ali].
What distinguishes them is that the Choryori perform namaz and fast, but the Panjtani do neither.
The Panjtani say: "Prayer and fasts won't bring you anything whether you do them or not, to tell you the truth."
The origin [of this division] is this: the Panjtani say that Bibi Fatima Zahra had a white ewe or a white camel whose name was Ramazon.
One day a group of people killed this white camel.
Then Bibi Fatima Zahra looked [for the camel] and asked them: "Where is it?"
Nobody spoke the truth, saying [instead]: "We don't know."
Then Bibi Fatima Zahra said: "If I call its name, it will appear."
Those who had eaten it were laughing at Bibi Fatima Zahra.
Then Bibi Fatima Zahra got angry and called: "Hey, Ramazon!"
The stomachs of all those who had eaten [the camel] tore open and the white camel appeared.
Those who had eaten it were the Choryori, who [now] keep a fast of forty days.
Those who didn't eat were on the side of Bibi Fatima Zahra, [and] they became Panjtani.
From this event it is clear that the festival of Ramazon is for the Choryori, but the law of the Panjtani is also to celabrate it in the month of Ramazon.
